title: NumPy: Array Slicing
story: Slicing lets you extract portions of arrays efficiently. Master this to work with subsets of your data.
instructions: Create array [10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70]. Extract elements from index 2 to 5 (inclusive of 2, exclusive of 5) and print the result.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Create array and slice
arr = np.array([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70])
sliced = arr[2:5]
print(sliced)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

arr = np.array([10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70])
sliced = arr[2:5]
print(sliced)

tests.expectedBehavior: Print sliced elements from index 2 to 5

hints.text: Use arr[start:end] syntax where end is exclusive.
Index 2 is the third element (30), index 5 is exclusive, so you get 3 elements.
